Detailed Description

This class is responsible for representing the download queue.

The CDownlodListCtrl class is responsible for drawing files being downloaded. It is in many ways primary widget within the application, since it is here that users can inspect and manipulate their current downloads.

void CDownloadListCtrl::AddFile ( CPartFile *  file  ) 

Adds a file to the list, but it wont show unless it matches the current category.

Parameters:
A valid pointer to a new partfile.

Please note that duplicates wont be added.

References m_category, m_ListItems, ShowFile(), and CMuleListCtrl::SortList().

Removes the specified file from the list.

Parameters:

This function also removes any sources assosiated with the file.

void CDownloadListCtrl::ShowFile ( CPartFile *  file,
bool  show 
)

Shows or hides the sources of a specific file.

Parameters:
file A valid pointer to the file to be shown/hidden.
show Whenever or not to show the file.

If the file is hidden, then its sources will also be hidden.

References m_ListItems, and ShowFilesCount().

Referenced by AddFile(), ChangeCategory(), RemoveFile(), and UpdateItem().

int CDownloadListCtrl::SortProc ( wxUIntPtr  item1,
wxUIntPtr  item2,
long  sortData 
) [static, private]

Wrapper around the user-provided sorter function.

This function ensures that items are sorted in the order specified by clicking on column-headers, and also enforces that different entries are never considered equal. This is required for lists that make use of child-items, since otherwise, parents may not end up properly located in relation to child-items.

Reimplemented from CMuleListCtrl.

References CMuleListCtrl::COLUMN_MASK, and CMuleListCtrl::SORT_DES.

void CDownloadListCtrl::UpdateItem ( const void *  toupdate  ) 

Updates the state of the specified item, possibly causing a redrawing.

Parameters:
toupdate The source or file to be updated.

Calling this function with a file as the argument will ensure that the file is hidden/shown depending on its state and the currently selected category.

References m_category, m_ListItems, and ShowFile().

Member Data Documentation

ListItems CDownloadListCtrl::m_ListItems [private]

This list contains everything shown on the list.

Sources are only to be found on this list if they are being displayed, whereas files can always be found on this list, even if they are currently hidden.

Referenced by AddFile(), ChangeCategory(), ClearCompleted(), RemoveFile(), ShowFile(), UpdateItem(), and ~CDownloadListCtrl().
